decision.reasoning:
The current market (60.2% Seahawks) is basically in line with ESPN Analytics (~59.6% SEA), so on pure baseline power ratings there isn‚Äôt an obvious edge.

What *does* look like potentially mispriced / not fully digested is the Patriots injury situation from multiple Super Bowl LX injury report sources: QB Drake Maye listed with right shoulder/illness and reported DNP, plus other defensive starters like Harold Landry (knee, DNP/limited) and Robert Spillane (ankle, limited). A QB shoulder issue this late in the week is the highest-leverage injury in football; even if Maye plays, any limitation meaningfully reduces NE‚Äôs win probability.

Given that, I think fair Seahawks win probability is a few points higher than 60.2% (closer to mid-60s) unless we get a clean ‚Äúfull participant, no designation‚Äù update for Maye. With that edge and my aggressive style, I want to be long Seahawks now before any confirmation pushes the price up.
